dmca.title: Unauthorized Use of Celebrity Image and Name
dmca.body:
nc

 

-----Original Message-----
From: Cyber Trackers - Safesearching.com [mailto:cycnus@comcast.net] 
Sent: Tuesday, February 15, 2005 6:14 PM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: FW: Unauthorized Use of Celebrity Image and Name
Importance: High
Sensitivity: Private

 

Please review the information provided below.  Please provide assistance in
this matter if you can.  This site is in complete copyright violation of a
number of celebrity images, not withstanding Alyssa Milano.  We ask you to
review this site and honor our request the site be shut down.

 

Thank you,

 

Safesearching.com

 

  _____  

From: William R. Charnock [mailto:wcharnock@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, February 15, 2005 10:05 AM
To: 'Cyber Trackers - Safesearching.com'; dnsadmin@tucows.com
Cc: 'Lin Milano'; 'Wilson, Dennis'; copyright@theplanet.com;
legal@theplanet.com
Subject: RE: Unauthorized Use of Celebrity Image and Name
Sensitivity: Private

 

These notices need to be sent to copyright@theplanet.com.  I am CC'ing them
on this response.

 


  _____  


From: Cyber Trackers - Safesearching.com [mailto:cycnus@comcast.net] 
Sent: Saturday, February 12, 2005 8:01 AM
To: wcharnock@theplanet.com; dnsadmin@tucows.com
Cc: Lin Milano; Wilson, Dennis
Subject: Unauthorized Use of Celebrity Image and Name
Importance: High
Sensitivity: Private

The site owner of the sites listed in the Cease and Desist notification
below does not provide contact information.  Therefore, we are requesting
your assistance in this matter.  We ask that the offending sites be shut
down, or the site owner notified his sites are in violation as noted.

 

Thank you.

 

===========================================

 

Saturday, February 12, 2005

 

 


Recipient E-mail Address:

wcharnock@theplanet.com


 

dnsadmin@tucows.com

 

Dear Sir or Madam:

 

This letter is being written to you on behalf of our client Alyssa Milano.

 

Your web site located at:  #http://www.cliffordcroft.com/origins.asp#; in
conjunction with the following associated links, et.al., (if applicable):

 


allscifi.com#http://allscifi.com#


allreaders.com#http://allreaders.com#

 

contains unauthorized reproductions of Ms. Milano's image.  Your
distribution of unauthorized images, as well as your use of Ms. Milano's
name in metatags on your web site, violate Ms. Milano's rights of publicity,
privacy, and trademark, and defames his/her reputation.

 

Without limitation, your conduct violates California Civil Code ' 3344 and
15 U.S.C.' 1125(a).  Further, your reproduction and distribution of the
images violate various copyrights held and/or licensed by Ms. Milano.

 

Moreover, because some of the images on this web site appear to have been
illegally copied from copyrighted films and/or photographs, your web site
may also infringe upon the rights of various copyright owners.

 

Ms. Milano greatly values the interest and loyalty of his/her fans, and has
created an official web site to allow a safe and appropriate place for
his/her fans to find him/her on the Internet.  Your distribution of
infringing images not only violates Ms. Milano's rights, but also hurts
his/her fans who unwillingly find themselves on your site rather than
his/her official site.  Your infringing actions are especially damaging
because of the sexually explicit content which appears on your web site.

 

We hereby demand that you and all those who have acted in concert with you
immediately cease any copying, transmission, or other use of Ms. Milano's
name and image, and that you delete from your site or other sites operated
or owned by you all unauthorized depictions of Alyssa Milano.

 

We expect that you will accede to our requests.  However, if we do not
receive your written confirmation before the close of business on 2/16/2005,
that you have complied with these requests, we will have no option but to
turn this matter over to litigation counsel.

 

Lin Milano

CEO, Safesearching

3575 Chauegna Blvd.

Los Angeles, CA  90068
